name: Herbed Italian Loaf
author: TI2GR
summary: I simply cannot keep up with the demand for this bread at home! The children want to set up a soup and bread stand just like the old lemonade stands. This dough is mixed in a bread machine but is baked in the oven.
ingredients: 1 ¼ cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
directions: Place warm water, sugar, 1 teaspoon salt, flour and yeast in the pan of the bread machine in the order recommended by the manufacturer
Most machines have a 'beep' toward the end of their cycle that allows you to add additional ingredients
Sprinkle in oregano and basil at this time
When machine's Dough cycle has ended, turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and shape into an oval or round loaf
Place loaf on a  baking sheet that has been well greased with olive oil
Cover with a damp towel and let rise in warm place until doubled, about 1 hour
In a small bowl, mix 2 tablespoons water with 1/4 teaspoon salt
Cut three slits on top of bread
Brush entire loaf with salt water mixture and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds
Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, until golden and bottom of loaf sounds hollow when tapped
This bread will be hard when it comes out of the oven
Let sit 10 minutes to soften before cutting
